intro: Phyllostegia axillaris, commonly known as the creeping bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. Phyllostegia axillaris thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
